newsitem.title: JAPAN: Four more former DKB executives arrested.
newsitem.headline: Four more former DKB executives arrested.

text.p: Tokyo prosecutors said on Tuesday they arrested another four former executives of Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd, one of Japan's largest banks, on charges of illegal payoffs to racketeers.

A statement issued by Tokyo prosecutors named the four as former DKB vice president Akira Kanazawa, 62, former vice president Tsuneo Uchida, 60, former managing director Yasuyuki Terasawa, 56, and former managing director Kenji Tanaka, 59. They were arrested on suspicion of violating Japan's Commercial Code.
Tanaka is currently president of Jusco Co, a major Japanese supermarket chain.

Prosecutors suspect that the four men conspired to provide 39 separate bank loans totalling 8.8 billion yen ($77.8 million) to Ryuichi Koike, a "sokaiya" corporate racketeer at the heart of a scandal which has already ensnared Nomura Securities Co Ltd.

The loans were allegedly made through Daiwa Shinyo, a financial institution affiliated with DKB, in violation of the Commercial Code, the statement said. Prosecutors had already arrested four other DKB officials earlier this month in connection with the scandal.
